id.description: No auto-increment in schema based on "id INT" vs "INT NOT NULL GENERATED BY DEFAULT..."? Ah wait, schema says "id INT". It doesn't denote "GENERATED". Usually primary keys are generated. I will assume it's NOT auto-increment if the schema explicitly omitted it, or it might be input-provided. But typically for 'id' PK it is. The schema provided for 'forms' says: "id INT, ... CONSTRAINT pk_forms_id PRIMARY KEY (id)". It lacks "GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY". I will NOT add autoIncrement to be safe, or user might provide IDs. But wait, typically models use uint for ID.
